thread.title: Diver catches close encounter with friendly seal on underwater camera
thread.title_full: Diver catches close encounter with friendly seal on underwater camera | Daily Mail Online

author: Darren Boyle for MailOnline
title: Diver catches close encounter with friendly seal on underwater camera
text:
788 shares 66
View
comments
A scuba diver had a close encounter with a friendly seal during a week-long holiday on the Isle of Scilly.
Gary Grayson, 55, from Salford, Greater Manchester, went on his adventure with the Dive Life group.
The seal was not nervous by the close attention and even allowed Mr Grayson to tickle its stomach.
Scroll down for video
Gary Grayson, right , met the seal, left, while on a diving holiday off the coast of the Isle of Scilly
During the encounter, the seal, right, allowed Mr Grayson, left, to rub him on his stomach
The undersea encounter was videoed and uploaded to the internet where it inevitably went viral.
So far, more than 3,600 people have shared the clip after Mr Grayson's friend shared the footage asking 'people ask why I love diving... this is why.'
Mr Grayson is a very experienced scuba diver having explored the oceans off the coasts of Mexico, St Lucia and Cuba.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next Mysterious hazardous material leaves two people dead and... Nazi gold train is FOUND: Deathbed confession leads treasure... Share this article Share On his trips, he has swam with crocodiles, dolphins and sharks.
But he insists that the almost three-minute-clip is the souvenir he treasures the most.
He said: 'I'm usually the one with the camera but when I saw everyone had taken a shine to this seal I said "you film, I want a go".
'I have been diving with seals before and had them buzzing around you before but I've never had one that stayed so close for that amount of time and was so friendly.
'It was amazing and something I'll never forget - I have the video on my phone now and watch it all the time.
'In fact, I've probably bored all my friends going on about it.'
Before the encounter, Mr Grayson was carrying his camera but passed it to a friend when the seal approached
Mr Grayson, pictured, from Salford, Greater Manchester said he will always cherish his time with the seal
As well as rubbing the seal's chest, the wild animal allowed Mr Grayson to stroke him under the chin
Mr Grayson said he is now semi-retired after selling his haulage firm.
Although, he has always been a bit of a thrill-seeker.
'I first got into diving after skydiving - I even skydived into my own wedding back in the eighties.
'I've now been lucky to dive all over the world after I took semi-retirement and decided to have some fun.
'It's great to be able to relax and have unforgettable moments like the one off the Isle of Scilly with the seal.'
In the past, the former haulage company owner has swam with dolphins, crocodiles and even sharks
But his greatest underwater moments are from his most recent holiday with the incredibly friendly seal
